si.title: ‘IMF austerity measures provoking widespread public discontent’
body_lines: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has become a polarizing figure in Sri Lanka as the country grapples with a deep economic crisis. ජාමූඅ විසින් යෝජනා කරන ලද, ජාතියේ ණය බරින් ආමන්ත්රණය කිරීම අරමුණු කරගත් ජාමූඅ විසින් යෝජනා කරන ලද කප්පාදු පියවර සාමාන්ය පුරවැසියන් අතර පුළුල් අතෘප්තියක් ඇති කර ඇති බව ජාත්යන්තර මිතුරන්ගේ සභාපති, රටවල් 74 ක බිම් මට්ටමේ පාරිසරික සංවිධාන විශාල ජාලයක් වන හේමන්ත විතානගේ මහතා පැවසීය.

Withanage added that the roles of the IMF and the World Bank in Sri Lanka over the past eight decades have been significant but complex. While their contributions to economic stabilization and development are notable, they have also provoked challenges and criticisms regarding social equity and governance.
He stressed that the critical question remains whether the people of Sri Lanka have truly benefited from their long-standing relationship with these institutions—a dilemma that continues to persist.

දිවයිනේ මූල්ය සමාලෝචනයට අදහස් දක්වමින් විතානගේ මහතා ශ්රී ලංකාව තුළ ජාමූඅ හි බලපෑම දශක ගණනාවක දිනපතා, මූල්ය ආධාර, ප්රතිපත්ති උපදෙස් සහ සංවර්ධන ව්යාපෘති හැඩගස්වන බව අවධාරණය කළේය.. කෙසේ වෙතත්, වසංගත හා භූදේශපාලනික ආතතීන්ගෙන් උග්ර වූ මෑත කාලීන ණය අර්බුදය ජාමූඅ හි කාර්යභාරය තියුණු අවධානය යොමු කර තිබේ.

විතානේගේ මහතා මෙසේ පැවසීය: 'බදු වැඩිවීම් සහ වියදම් කප්පාදුව ඇතුළු ජාමූඅ හි යෝජිත ක්රියාමාර්ග දුප්පත් හා අවදානමට ලක්විය හැකි අයට අසමාන ලෙස බලපායි. Many argue that the government should prioritize debt restructuring and explore alternative avenues for economic recovery rather than imposing harsh austerity measures.

මෙම අභියෝග නොතකා, ජාමූඅ ශ්රී ලංකාවේ ආර්ථික අනාගතයේ ප්රධාන ක්රීඩකයෙකු ලෙස කටයුතු කරයි. The country’s recent agreement with the IMF for a bailout package offers a glimmer of hope, but the road to recovery is likely to be long and arduous. As Sri Lanka navigates these turbulent times, the debate over the IMF’s role and the effectiveness of its policies will continue to shape the country’s economic destiny.

`IMF has become a prominent topic in Sri Lanka due to the austerity measures it proposed to address the country’s debt crisis. These measures have increased taxes for ordinary citizens, while the previous interim government warned that Sri Lanka would face further difficulties if it did not adhere to the IMF package agreed upon in mid-2022.

'මෑතකදී පැවති ජනාධිපතිවරණයේදී ජාමූඅ පැකේජය ප්රධාන කාරණයක් වූ අතර, එහි ප්රති ing ලයක් ලෙස අතුරුමු.අ.1.. The election was won by left-party politician Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who takes a more measured approach to the IMF.

`Over the past 80 years, IMF and the World Bank involvement in Sri Lanka has included a mix of financial assistance, policy advice, and development projects, significantly influencing the country’s economic trajectory.

‘The IMF’s and World Bank’s impact on Sri Lanka’s economy and society has been multifaceted. එක් අතකින්, ඔවුන්ගේ මූල්ය ආධාර හා සංවර්ධන ව්යාපෘති යටිතල පහසුකම්, සෞඛ්යය හා අධ්යාපනයේ අත්යවශ්ය දියුණුව සඳහා දායක වී තිබේ. Rural communities have benefited from improved access to basic services and economic policies supported by the IMF have, at times, restored macroeconomic stability.

අනෙක් අතට, ව්යුහාත්මක ගැලපුම් වැඩසටහන් හා කප්පාදු පියවර හා සම්බන්ධ සමාජ පිරිවැය ගැටළු මතු කර ඇත. වෙළඳපල මත පදනම් වූ ප්රතිපත්ති කෙරෙහි අවධානය යොමු කිරීම බොහෝ විට වඩාත් අවදානමට ලක්විය හැකි ජනගහනයේ අවශ්යතා නොසලකා හරියි. අසමානතාවය සහ දුප්පත්කම අභියෝගයන් එල්ල වන අතර, වර්ධනයේ ප්රතිලාභ ඒකාකාරව බෙදා හැර නොමැති බැවින්. Whatever the solutions these spin doctors have given, about 24% of the population became poor due to the debt crisis that began in 2020.

‘According to a more recent report by the FAO and the United Nations World Food Programme, it is estimated that 3.9 million people or 17% of the population, are in moderate acute food insecurity. ජාමූඅ එහි වැඩවලට ප්රශංසා කිරීමට සහ එහි උපදෙස් නිරන්තරයෙන් සොයා බැලීමට නිලධරයන් සහ දේශපාලන politicians යින් පුහුණු කර ඇත. Since joining the IMF, Sri Lanka has received assistance at least 16 times. අපි යම් යම් ගැටළු ආමන්ත්රණය කළ අතර, අපගේ ණය අඛණ්ඩව ඉහළ යන අතර ජනගහනයට අහිතකර ලෙස බලපායි. '
පිළිතුරක් තබන්න ටෙස්ට් යුය ඔබගේ ඊමේල් ලිපිනය ප්රකාශයට පත් නොකෙරේ. අවශ්ය ක්ෂේත්ර * අදහස් දැක්වීම * නම *
Save my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment.

ta.title: ‘IMF austerity measures provoking widespread public discontent’
body_lines: சர்வதேச நாணய நிதியம் (ஐ.எம்.எஃப்) இலங்கையில் ஒரு துருவமுனைக்கும் நபராக மாறியுள்ளது, ஏனெனில் நாடு ஆழ்ந்த பொருளாதார நெருக்கடியால் பிடிக்கிறது. The austerity measures proposed by the IMF, aimed at addressing the nation’s debt burden, have sparked widespread discontent among ordinary citizens, said Hemantha Withanage, Chair of Friends of the International, a large network of grassroots environmental organizations from 74 countries.

Withanage added that the roles of the IMF and the World Bank in Sri Lanka over the past eight decades have been significant but complex. While their contributions to economic stabilization and development are notable, they have also provoked challenges and criticisms regarding social equity and governance.
He stressed that the critical question remains whether the people of Sri Lanka have truly benefited from their long-standing relationship with these institutions—a dilemma that continues to persist.

தீவு நிதி மறுஆய்வுடன் பேசிய விதானேஜ், இலங்கையில் சர்வதேச நாணய நிதியத்தின் செல்வாக்கு பல தசாப்தங்களாகவே உள்ளது, இது நிதி உதவி, கொள்கை ஆலோசனை மற்றும் மேம்பாட்டுத் திட்டங்கள் மூலம் நாட்டின் பொருளாதார நிலப்பரப்பை வடிவமைக்கிறது. எவ்வாறாயினும், சமீபத்திய கடன் நெருக்கடி, தொற்றுநோய் மற்றும் புவிசார் அரசியல் பதட்டங்களால் அதிகரித்துள்ளது, சர்வதேச நாணய நிதியத்தின் பங்கை கூர்மையான கவனம் செலுத்தியுள்ளது.

விதைனேஜ் மேலும் கூறினார்: ‘வரி உயர்வு மற்றும் செலவின வெட்டுக்கள் உள்ளிட்ட சர்வதேச நாணய நிதியத்தின் முன்மொழியப்பட்ட நடவடிக்கைகள் ஏழைகளையும் பாதிக்கப்படக்கூடியவர்களையும் விகிதாசாரமாக பாதிக்கின்றன என்று விமர்சிக்கப்பட்டுள்ளன. Many argue that the government should prioritize debt restructuring and explore alternative avenues for economic recovery rather than imposing harsh austerity measures.

`Despite these challenges, the IMF remains a key player in Sri Lanka’s economic future. பிணை எடுப்பு தொகுப்புக்கான சர்வதேச நாணய நிதியத்துடனான நாட்டின் சமீபத்திய ஒப்பந்தம் நம்பிக்கையின் பிரகாசத்தை வழங்குகிறது, ஆனால் மீட்புக்கான பாதை நீண்ட மற்றும் கடினமானதாக இருக்கும். As Sri Lanka navigates these turbulent times, the debate over the IMF’s role and the effectiveness of its policies will continue to shape the country’s economic destiny.

`IMF has become a prominent topic in Sri Lanka due to the austerity measures it proposed to address the country’s debt crisis. These measures have increased taxes for ordinary citizens, while the previous interim government warned that Sri Lanka would face further difficulties if it did not adhere to the IMF package agreed upon in mid-2022.

‘The IMF package was a key issue in the recent presidential election, resulting in a significant loss for the interim president, a strong proponent of IMF solutions. The election was won by left-party politician Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who takes a more measured approach to the IMF.

`Over the past 80 years, IMF and the World Bank involvement in Sri Lanka has included a mix of financial assistance, policy advice, and development projects, significantly influencing the country’s economic trajectory.

‘The IMF’s and World Bank’s impact on Sri Lanka’s economy and society has been multifaceted. On the one hand, their financial assistance and development projects have contributed to essential advancements in infrastructure, health, and education. சர்வதேச நாணய நிதியத்தால் ஆதரிக்கப்படும் அடிப்படை சேவைகளுக்கான மேம்பட்ட அணுகல் மற்றும் சில சமயங்களில், மேக்ரோ பொருளாதார நிலைத்தன்மையை மீட்டெடுத்துள்ளதால் கிராமப்புற சமூகங்கள் பயனடைந்துள்ளன.

‘On the other hand, the social costs associated with structural adjustment programs and austerity measures have raised concerns. Focus on market-driven policies often overlooked the needs of the most vulnerable populations. வளர்ச்சியின் நன்மைகள் சமமாக விநியோகிக்கப்படாததால், சமத்துவமின்மை மற்றும் வறுமை ஆகியவை சவால்களை அழுத்துகின்றன. Whatever the solutions these spin doctors have given, about 24% of the population became poor due to the debt crisis that began in 2020.

‘According to a more recent report by the FAO and the United Nations World Food Programme, it is estimated that 3.9 million people or 17% of the population, are in moderate acute food insecurity. The IMF has trained bureaucrats and politicians to praise its work and seek its advice constantly. Since joining the IMF, Sri Lanka has received assistance at least 16 times. நாங்கள் சில சிக்கல்களைத் தீர்க்கும் போது, ​​எங்கள் கடன் தொடர்ந்து உயர்ந்து கொண்டிருக்கிறது, இது மக்கள்தொகையை மோசமாக பாதிக்கிறது. ’
ஒரு பதிலை விடுங்கள் ரத்துசெய் உங்கள் மின்னஞ்சல் முகவரி வெளியிடப்படாது. தேவையான புலங்கள் குறிக்கப்பட்டுள்ளன * கருத்து * பெயர் *
